about_the_game:
Welcome to Braunau - 1889!


In the heart-pounding battleground of World War II, a daring mission was initiated by the fearless Allies. Armed with the mind-bending power of recently unearthed ancient alien technology, they embarked on a covert operation that defied the very fabric of time itself. Their target: Braunau-Am-Inn, the notorious birthplace of the tyrant Adolf Hitler. Their mission: to eradicate history's most malevolent dictator by eliminating him on the very day he took his first breath. The fate of the entire world hung in the balance, and failure was not an option.

As these extraordinary agents united under a common cause, their individual ambitions and ulterior motives simmered beneath the surface. With loyalty hanging by a thread, they braced themselves for the treacherous path ahead, knowing that betrayal lurked in the shadows, ready to strike at any moment.




However, unbeknown to the Allies, their covert operation had been compromised. The enigmatic B.O.R.I.N.G. division, a secret organisation known as the Bureau of Occult Research for the Improvement of Nazi Germany, had stumbled upon the same ancient alien technology. Their fanatical leader, Colonel Von Apfelstrudel, ruthlessly commanded his elite forces to counter the Allies' audacious plan. It was a clash of titans, a high-stakes battle where the very course of history would be shaped by the victor.





But the drama did not end there. Deep within the heart of Braunau-Am-Inn, a rebel faction known as F.I.S.T. (Front for an Independent and Sovereign Tirol) had already established its presence. Once fervent dreamers of a world purified by Tirolean values, they had succumbed to a darker path. Under the ambitious and corrupt leadership of Ursula Von der Ledershosen, their new objective was to seize power in Braunau by any means necessary. Little did they know that they were unwittingly playing into the hands of Herr Pfizz, a cunning local pharmacist with a secret fortune amassed from his nefarious snake oil empire. He discreetly bankrolled their sinister organization, using them as pawns in his wicked game.





Caught in the crossfire of these warring factions were the unsuspecting, yet resilient, people of Braunau. Their desire for unity and celebration around the revered statue of Saint-Schnitzel, the patron saint of the town, was about to be shattered. Oblivious to the impending chaos, they reveled in their local delicacies—a tantalizing blend of pretzels and sausages—washed down with the finest handcrafted beers and homemade schnaps. Little did they know that their idyllic existence was about to collide head-on with a cataclysmic battle for the very essence of their town.





Welcome to "Let's Kill Hitler," a thrilling escapade that invites you to step into the shoes of those who shaped the destiny of an era. Prepare to rewrite history in a furious whirlwind of action, suspense, and explosive encounters. The fate of the world hangs in the balance, and only the bravest will prevail in this adrenaline-fueled rollercoaster ride through the annals of time.

Squeaky humour, conspiracy theories and references to 80's movies!


Delve into a game world in which the darkest occult powers collide with pop culture and internet memes to produce a carefully crafted unique mix which is then refined through massive injection of irony and parody to produce a delightful tribute to squeaky humour.

Enjoy our not so subtle references to a variety of sources of inspiration, from the roaring 80's classic Hollywood movies to the best (or worst?) widespread conspiracy theories and modern day politics. Imagine John Carpenter directing an episode of History Channel's Ancient Aliens according to a scenario written by Rowan Atkinson, or Spinal Tap meets Indiana Jones meets Saving Private Ryan and you'll get a good idea of what you are about to experience...

Play Let's Kill Hitler as a video game, a board game or a tabletop RPG!


We declined the game world and mechanics both as a video game, a board game assisted by a Virtual Companion app and a classic tabletop RPG backed by a Virtual TableTop app, so you can enjoy our silly rules and sense of humour the way you prefer, or get all three!

The video game version develops all three aspects of the game: RPG, Strategy and Deck Builder, while the board game focuses on the Strategy and Deck Building aspects, and the tabletop RPG is of course...a RPG.

Our video-game supports Solo mode as well as Multiplayer PvP and Co-op for up to 6 players, the board game plays 2 to 7 players, while when it comes to the TTRPG, the only limit is the one which is set by the DM...

Availability


Our plan is to release our video game this winter, with a playable demo early fall and an early-access mode late fall, for PC, Mac and Linux.

We will launch a crowdfunding campaign end of summer for support of the Virtual Tabletop RPG and the general support of our quests development both in the video game and in the tabletop RPG, and a separate crowdfunding this fall for the board game.

We already started publishing an online guide to Braunau, 1889 using World Anvil, and will keep on updating it regularly, as well as publishing information via YouTube and Twitter.

linux_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Processor: 1.8 Ghz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
linux_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Processor: 2 Ghz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

mac_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Processor: 2 Ghz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

name: Let's Kill Hitler - The Game

pc_requirements.minimum:
Minimum:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • OS: 10
  • Processor: 1.8 Ghz
  • Memory: 1 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space
pc_requirements.recommended:
Recommended:
  • Requires a 64-bit processor and operating system
  • Processor: 2 Ghz
  • Memory: 2 GB RAM
  • Storage: 1 GB available space

short_description: RPG / Strategy / Deckbuilder, Solo / Multiplayer / Co-op. Travel back in time, kill Hitler, alone or with friends ! Defeat secret agents, UFOs, reptilians and other occult forces in a fast paced game filled with squeaky humour, references to 80's movies and conspiracy theories !
supported_languages: English, French, Italian, Spanish - Spain, Bulgarian, Spanish - Latin America, Japanese
